Text:
Women—particularly women of color—bear a disproportionate burden of the student loan debt crisis. 

President Biden can take action now and use his existing legal authority to #CancelStudentDebt.

We won't stop working to get this done. https://t.co/VLBaCjzdGT

Oh, we’re not trying to silence you. We’re going to make sure everyone knows about your plan to raise taxes on ‘over half of Americans’!

It’s right there on page 35: https://t.co/vG6R3GVJpb https://t.co/6DGdC7U1Fy

Senator Rick Scott explains the Republican plan to raise taxes on more than half of Americans.

He wants working families and seniors to pay more.

https://t.co/5Sqjtk8LuT

Stephen Myers was a leader of Albany’s Underground Railroad, chair of his local Vigilance Committee & publisher of multiple abolitionist newspapers

Born into slavery—he dedicated his life to abolition & improving living conditions for Albany’s Black community

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/MxgVLsmape

Insulin costs have been rapidly rising for years. Millions of Americans with diabetes are forced to make impossible decisions. It's dangerous and wrong.

I was proud to stand with New Yorkers in Buffalo fighting diabetes. @SenateDems will move forward on a bill to fix this. https://t.co/Q0TEkf65fF

Billy Strayhorn was a talented composer, jazz pianist, and arranger.

He moved to Harlem in the 1930s to work with Duke Ellington’s legendary band.

A strong activist for civil rights, his music captured the Black experience in America.

#BlackHistoryMonth
https://t.co/9j04dW0hE2
It was an honor to march in the Chinatown Lunar New Year Parade today in New York City and celebrate the #YearOfTheTiger! https://t.co/d2pAJH3Pzn

It’s preposterous and dangerous that a 40-day supply of insulin can cost over $600.

This is a crisis, and @SenateDems will move forward on a bill to fix it.

The millions of Americans with diabetes stand with us—like the New Yorkers standing with me today to tell their stories. https://t.co/4EG9cFp2vp

Mary Pinkett was the first Black woman elected to the New York City Council.

She was a strong voice for Black Americans, women, and workers throughout the city.

Serving from 1974 to 2001, she lived in Brooklyn her entire life.

#BlackHistoryMonth

https://t.co/ahEhsdAmlb
I was so honored to celebrate the Lunar New Year today with @UA3Now1, a group that does such great work for our community, in South Ozone Park! #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/kTNXorRUHo

Damian Williams is the first Black U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

I was incredibly proud to have recommended his nomination to President Biden.

He is now working tirelessly to ensure equal justice under the law.

#BlackHistoryMonth

https://t.co/wo58IUrEMU

We’re standing together to work with FEMA to expedite COVID reimbursements for our New York hospitals and health care providers and get them everything they need to battle this pandemic:

https://t.co/1w0I8UTP9Y
This is a key step in President Biden’s #Justice40 Initiative, our commitment to fighting environmental injustice, and our work to deliver for disadvantaged communities: https://t.co/5Dqxwvy62W

Lorraine Hansberry was an activist, writer, and award-winning playwright.

She became the first Black woman to write a play performed on Broadway with the production of "A Raisin in the Sun."

#BlackHistoryMonth
https://t.co/CotCcFAnHn

Dr. Lorna Breen was a NYC health care hero who lost her life to suicide at the pandemic's height. Tonight, we passed a bill in her honor to help health care workers with their mental health. It now goes to @POTUS's desk. To Dr. Breen and her family, thank you for all you've done.

Democrats are focused on lowering costs for Americans, including by taking aim at insulin prices.

It’s preposterous that some pay over $600 for a 40-day supply.

This issue is a priority for @SenateDems. I’m proud @SenatorWarnock has introduced legislation to fix this.

Tonight, I took steps on the Senate floor to move forward on the Women’s Health Protection Act.

Because a woman’s right to choose is a fundamental right, and this Senate will vote on the Women’s Health Protection Act to protect abortion rights.

Comprehensive federal cannabis legalization with justice for the communities most impacted by the War on Drugs—especially communities of color—is a Senate priority.

This is long overdue, and we will move forward. https://t.co/tgqQjyR6QG

Ithaca is paving the way to a greener and ‘gorges’ future.

I am proud to announce this $7 million federal investment through the Biden Department of @Energy that will supercharge our efforts to deliver critical clean energy solutions and create good paying jobs in Upstate NY. https://t.co/yByeuZKv1A

President Biden is right!

I’ve long pushed for U.S. investment in EV infrastructure, and I’m proud we delivered historic funding to build EV chargers and purchase clean transit and school buses in the infrastructure law we passed. https://t.co/AW0WXkEpvA

Great step!

I stood with organizers in NYC last week to push @POTUS to #CancelStudentDebt from for-profit colleges

Some of student debt's worst drivers—they target communities of color, veterans, low-income people, & more

But @POTUS must go much further to #CancelStudentDebt! https://t.co/NhMJ4Eprf5

A firefighter with Ladder 134 in Queens. From Long Island. A 7-year veteran of the FDNY. Our hearts are broken by the loss of FDNY Firefighter Jesse Gerhard who died in the line of duty. We're praying for his family, friends, fellow firefighters, and all who knew and loved him. https://t.co/x4QjAPsKdU

Percy Sutton was an activist, lawyer, and politician.

He served in the New York State Assembly, becoming Manhattan's 21st Borough President in 1966.

As a Freedom Rider and attorney for Malcolm X, he dedicated his life to the civil rights movement.

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/Qm8echR4AU

Americans are sending a clear message:

The vast majority support legalizing adult use of cannabis

As Senate Majority Leader, comprehensive federal cannabis reform with equity for the communities most impacted by the War on Drugs is a top Senate priority
https://t.co/OnumEPcBXa

After visiting Rochester last month to push for additional medical personnel for Strong Memorial Hospital, I’m proud to say that help has arrived.

Rochester’s frontline heroes will now be given the support they need as they continue to combat COVID.

https://t.co/ywqWu9BrEp

Republican Senator Tom Cotton is trying to block us from confirming DOJ appointees.

These cheap partisan games make Americans less safe.

But make no mistake: He will lose this dangerous fight, and we will confirm these nominees.

Todd Duncan was the first Black singer to join the New York City Opera.

Over his career, he performed in over 2000 recitals in over 50 countries.

He originated the role of Porgy in "Porgy and Bess".

His career helped pave the way for so many Black artists. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/sYDjEfkPJl

Our economy created 6.6 million jobs in President Biden's first year.

6.6 MILLION JOBS

And Dems remain laser-focused on lowering costs for the American people:

—Lowering childcare costs
—Lowering insulin costs
—Fixing supply chains
—Boosting US manufacturing
—And so much more!

I'm honored to introduce Nina Morrison to @JudiciaryDems

On my recommendation, she’s @POTUS’s nominee for District Judge for NY's Eastern District

Not from a big corporate firm, she’s dedicated her career to the @Innocence Project—representing people wrongly convicted of crimes https://t.co/y164QTeXR0

We had 6.6M new jobs in one year!

And now whether it’s child care, insulin, supply chains, semiconductor chips, American manufacturing, what’s on the dinner table, or more:

Democrats are moving forward with solutions to bring down costs for Americans.

https://t.co/T5ThPDr3pU

The Senate stands with the people of Ukraine and our NATO allies and partners most threatened by Russian aggression

Our troops stand ready to reinforce our allies' defenses

We are prepared to respond decisively to Russian efforts to undermine US security
https://t.co/Qi4M1l0WNu

The economy added 6.6 million new jobs last year—the most ever for a President’s first year!

But Americans still need us to find ways to lower prices

We are working on legislation to cut costs, fix supply chains, and boost American manufacturing

https://t.co/T5ThPDIEOu

Alvin Ailey was a trailblazing dancer, choreographer, & activist.

He founded the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater in New York City in 1958.

His revolutionary art honored the Black American experience through dance, and his impact continues to be felt today. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/ydNcVvusYe

Our constituents want us to fix the USPS. They can’t have prescriptions or Social Security checks coming late.

GOP Senator Rick Scott has decided to use a technical detail to try to hold up postal reform.

But he won’t stop us. We will pass it. https://t.co/71LDNXtBf9

I stand with the hardworking immigrant workers in New York and across the country who are taking part today in the #DayWithoutImmigrants protest.

Senate Democrats will continue to pursue every means to achieve immigration reform with a pathway to citizenship. https://t.co/uVKZ6FsvhB

Under @POTUS, the Senate has confirmed 46 federal judges.
3/4 have been women.
2/3 have been people of color.

ALL have been highly qualified.

They are public defenders, civil rights and election lawyers, people with public-service experience.

And we’re going to keep going.

President Biden has promised that he will nominate a Black Woman to serve as a Supreme Court Justice for the first time ever.

That will be an important moment in the history of the Supreme Court and in the history of our country.

A leading figure of the Stonewall Uprising, and an activist for trans rights, for all LGBTQ rights, in the fight against AIDS, and more:
 
We honor and remember Marsha P. Johnson's legacy. #BlackHistoryMonth
 
https://t.co/E4kOmZpqRt

4 years ago—17 lives were taken in the horrific shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School

We remember the students and educators who were killed

We stand with the survivors

We stand with the families, loved ones

We continue to work for meaningful gun safety legislation

Happy 190th Birthday to @CityofUtica!

I hope you’re celebrating with tomato pie, riggies, @SaranacBrewery and so much more!

I’m standing together today with postal workers from NYC, postal workers from Long Island, and an Etsy entrepreneur who depends on the USPS.

We will move forward in the Senate to pass the Postal Service Reform Act and help strengthen one of America’s most important institutions. https://t.co/kSDiilHkV4

Hattie Carthan worked to change conservation in Brooklyn.

An environmentalist who co-founded the Bedford-Stuyvesant Beautification Committee, she also created the Magnolia Tree Earth Center and planted over 1,500 trees in the area.

#BlackHistoryMonth

https://t.co/4GPuN1l4Pf
Wish the @BuffaloBills were playing in the Super Bowl, but at least Yonkers' own @MaryJBlige will be repping New York at halftime!
Today would be a great day for President Biden and Vice President Harris to #CancelStudentDebt.

I'm honored to work with unions as we fight to #CancelStudentDebt.

I stood this week with staunch allies @UUPinfo, @PSC_Cuny, @SW_Columbia, @UAWRegion9A, and @NYTWA to work for President Biden to #CancelStudentDebt.

This will help young people to be able to follow their dreams. https://t.co/ZvqfdPJOZ6
Thank you to NYC Council Member Shekar Krishnan @VoteShekar for having me at your Lunar New Year celebration today in Queens! #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/RMgbQHVnRo
We have a great coalition fighting side-by-side to work for President Biden to #CancelStudentDebt! https://t.co/lAVrQ4w8By

Lena Horne was a groundbreaking performer and civil rights activist

Starting her career at the historic Cotton Club in Harlem:

She became the first Black woman to sign a long-term Hollywood agency contract, and she refused roles that stereotyped Black women

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/Wwsv2ah8dS

I’m incredibly proud to have WNY native Kaitlin Hawayek competing in ice dancing at the Olympics!

Good luck Kaitlin. We’re all cheering for you! 

https://t.co/qn8ba5QUHG

I was proud to stand with @NAACPNYS, @NYUrbanLeague, @NAACP, and @NatUrbanLeague today in New York to fight back against predatory for-profit colleges.

Many of these for-profit schools systematically target Black communities.

We need @POTUS to act to #CancelStudentDebt now. https://t.co/oLbcDB32FT

This entire team is incredible, Ashley Caldwell, Justin Schoenefeld, and Chris Lillis!

And I’m proud to say that Chris Lillis is from Rochester, New York! All of New York is beaming with pride! https://t.co/cNstC8BkhS

Born into slavery in NY—Sojourner Truth was a fierce advocate for abolition and suffrage

She helped enslaved people escape

She helped recruit Black troops to the Union Army

She worked for women's rights—including giving her famous "Ain't I A Woman?" speech

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/DKQEuhN5OB

In New York, 2.4 million people owe almost $93 billion in federal student loan debt.

That is a crisis.

President Biden must take action now and use his existing legal authority to #CancelStudentDebt.

Without action, student loan payments will resume on May 1.

Today would be a great day for President Biden and Vice President Harris to #CancelStudentDebt.

One of the worst drivers of the student debt crisis is FOR-PROFIT COLLEGES.

Many of these schools are predatory institutions that target communities of color, veterans, low-income people, and more.

To help people who've been impacted, @POTUS needs to #CancelStudentDebt now. https://t.co/dAiJZ8oscY
I’m so proud to join the swearing-in ceremony for our newest New York State Assemblymember @AMEddieGibbs! https://t.co/TMBnlFysDW

Hundreds of millions of Americans live in states where cannabis has been legalized in some way.

It’s long past time for the federal government to catch up.

The Senate will move forward on cannabis legalization with justice for the communities most impacted by the War on Drugs.
Today would be a great day for President Biden and Vice President Harris to #CancelStudentDebt

A major figure of the Harlem Renaissance.
 
Singer, pianist, and comedian, Gladys Bentley helped break barriers for LGBTQ+ performers.
 
We remember and honor Gladys Bentley’s story. #BlackHistoryMonth
 
https://t.co/dHamOS0Jgf

Americans rely on the postal service every single day.

Passing the Postal Service Reform Act is one of the best steps we can take to strengthen one of our country’s most important institutions.

The Senate will take its first vote to move forward on this bill on Monday!

The Violence Against Women Act must be reauthorized.

Survivors of domestic violence and abuse have waited too long for Congress to act.

We cannot allow inaction to persist for a moment longer. With this announcement—we are closer to achieving that goal and taking Senate action. https://t.co/Ep3mNjDwNs

This is big news:

The Senate just passed the bill to eliminate for good the awful practice of forcing victims of workplace sexual harassment and assault into arbitration.

The House has acted. The Senate has acted. And now it's on to President Biden’s desk.

As Senate Majority Leader, I can set priorities.

And comprehensive federal cannabis legalization with justice for the communities most impacted by the War on Drugs—especially communities of color—is a Senate priority.

We will move forward.

Since 2010, 37 states have legalized medical use of cannabis and 18 states have legalized both medical and adult use.

It’s long past time for the Senate to act. @SenBooker, @RonWyden, and I plan to introduce comprehensive cannabis legalization soon.

Here’s what @SenBooker, @RonWyden, and I just told the Senate:

As more and more states legalize cannabis, the Senate's long overdue in addressing this issue and righting the wrongs of the past.

With your help, we plan to introduce comprehensive cannabis legalization soon. https://t.co/6aG7RDO4VU
Today, the Senate is voting on confirming more of President Biden’s highly-qualified nominees for his administration!

Americans rely on the Postal Service for medicines, essential goods, voting, correspondence, and their livelihoods.

But it needs reform and it has for over a decade.

With the overwhelming House vote for postal reform—I intend for the Senate to quickly take up and pass the bill!

Writer. Feminist. Civil Rights Activist.
 
Lorde’s work spoke to issues of race, gender, sexuality, class, and more.
 
Audre Lorde’s legacy is one that must be celebrated and continued. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/H2vw420rGL

With the House voting overwhelmingly for postal reform

I intend for the Senate to take up and pass the bill before this work period ends

It’ll improve service for millions who rely on the Postal Service for medicines, essential goods, voting, correspondence, & their livelihoods

Today, I introduced Assemblymember Nick Perry to @SFRCdems to be Ambassador to Jamaica.

Not only is he Jamaican-born—he is a Brooklynite through and through.

I am so proud to support him, and I was proud to recommend him to President Biden for this role. https://t.co/Qz5Lc29rN0

A big step to eliminating forced arbitration for victims of sexual harassment and assault!

This is about making workplaces safer, holding abusive employers accountable, ensuring people can exercise their right to seek justice in court

We'll take up the bill as soon as this week https://t.co/5DbctD4aMQ

Edmonia Lewis was born in Greenbush, NY in 1844

She was a sculptor whose work explored literature, history, abolitionism, race, and more

She broke down barriers to become the first Black and Native American sculptors to receive international recognition
https://t.co/7y7W9gwfrI

A top scholar on the Holocaust and on modern-day antisemitism, Dr. Deborah Lipstadt is @POTUS’s nominee for Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Antisemitism

I'm proud to speak at her @SFRCDems confirmation hearing

Antisemitism must be confronted whenever it rears its ugly head

I'm honored to introduce NY's Nick Perry to @SFRCDems

Immigrant from Jamaica
Veteran
Public servant
He was my rec to @POTUS to be Amb. to Jamaica

I know he’ll make America and his family proud—his wife Joyce, son Nickolas Alexander, daughter Novalie, granddaughter Justine Skye https://t.co/q8bZhgV95A

Ahead of his confirmation hearing with @SFRCdems tomorrow:

I was honored to meet tonight with Brooklyn Assemblymember Nick Perry.

I recommended him to President Biden to be the next U.S. Ambassador to Jamaica. He’d be the first-ever U.S. Ambassador to Jamaica born in Jamaica! https://t.co/U0xg5iDxnK

January 6th was an armed insurrection

An attempt to reverse, through violent means, the outcome of a free and fair election

Rooted in Donald Trump’s Big Lie

A Big Lie the RNC seems to now be officially giving its blessing

It’s chilling and dangerous https://t.co/ddJaqrOo5E

At least 26 HBCUs have reported bomb threats in 2022.

Using fear, violence, and racism to try to steal the promise of a good education from millions of Black Americans is sickening.

We’re working with all relevant agencies to ensure those responsible are prosecuted.

Once the House passes legislation today to end forced arbitration for sexual assault & harassment:

We'll move as soon as this week to quickly take up this bill

It's a chance to finally act to nullify forced arbitration clauses that force survivors into a secret & biased process

In one year alone, the economy has added an incredible 6.6 million jobs.

That’s the most ever recorded for a President’s first year.

And President Biden and Democrats won’t stop working for people across this country. https://t.co/1FXoMB0phj

Langston Hughes’ poems, novels, plays, and more made him a leading figure in the Harlem Renaissance.
 
Hughes dedicated his work to telling the stories of Black life in America and was known as the people’s poet. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/0RawRggBiA

Intolerance and violence like this has no place in New York or anywhere else, and it must be confronted and overcome. I will continue to work with organizations like @UnitedJewish to keep the community safe. https://t.co/JWXfiyeTKd

Student debt has created both an economic and a mental health crisis for millions of Americans.
 
President Biden can #CancelStudentDebt today and provide much needed relief.
 
https://t.co/ULUPV0lFes

Gun Violence Survivors Week helps share the stories of the survivors of gun violence and how they've lived with the trauma they’ve endured.

As we honor #GVSurvivorsWeek, Senate Democrats continue to work for meaningful, commonsense gun safety legislation. https://t.co/CCculoPIaf

It was so fun to celebrate our successful work in securing $75M in funding to help complete Bushwick Inlet Park.

Community engagement and activism from @BushwickInlet, @RepMaloney, @EmilyAssembly, @LincolnRestler, @BrianKavanaghNY, and so many more led to this moment! https://t.co/laa1BYxJb5
I was so proud to help open the United Chinese Association of Brooklyn’s new Sheepshead Bay branch today as we celebrate the Lunar New Year together! #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/azHccq3eiQ

El Caño Martín Peña es uno de los peores ejemplos de injusticia ambiental. Por años, Trump se rehusó a actuar.

Trabajamos junto al presidente Biden para asegurar los fondos para restaurar el Caño.

Seguiremos luchando por igualdad y justicia para nuestros compatriotas de PR. https://t.co/EuAi5En6DH

Ernestine Eckstein was a true trailblazer—leading the NY chapter of the Daughters of Bilitis and organizing some of the first public demonstrations for LGBTQ+ rights.

We honor her visionary leadership in the fight for equal rights and protections for all. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/de1jHN85wq
Thank you to the Korean American Association of Greater New York @TheKAAGNY for having me yesterday to celebrate the Lunar New Year together in Queens! #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/lIPfl9InR3
I was honored to join the Flushing Lunar New Year Parade today! I’m wishing everyone good fortune and happiness. #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/nFTN2yg1f3

Austin Steward was not only a distinguished author, but also a successful entrepreneur in Rochester

Steward dedicated his life to working for Black suffrage, and in 1857 he published his famed autobiography: Twenty-Two Years a Slave, and Forty Years a Freeman

#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/6jX14lrsou

I am pleased to fight for marijuana reform with @DPA_NY, @VOCALNewYork, @ImmDefense, @BronxDefenders, @LegalAidNYC, @RWDSU, @Local338, and more.

I’ll keep working with them for marijuana justice at the federal level! https://t.co/xR4W4MA3eq

As Majority Leader—I can set priorities

Comprehensive federal marijuana legalization with justice for the communities most impacted by the War on Drugs—especially communities of color—is a Senate priority

With marijuana justice, the people are on our side. We will move forward. https://t.co/gtt6YVpHHG
#BidenBoom https://t.co/OtTrW0Tfkt

I stood with an extraordinary group of organizers, advocates, and legislators to renew our work in the Senate for comprehensive federal marijuana legalization.

We need to bring the spirit of New York’s groundbreaking legalization and address the wrongs of the War on Drugs. https://t.co/C9eyenSqA1
"You must never be fearful of what you're doing when it is right." —Rosa Parks https://t.co/MN9raF5Qpa

Connie Mitchell was the first Black woman elected in Monroe County, NY.

Her fight for better living and working conditions in Rochester blazed a trail for generations of leaders, earning her the Frederick Douglass Medal in 2017.

#BlackHistoryMonth

https://t.co/5j29CN3Gsi

With President Biden and Democrats in the Senate and House:

Jobs are ⬆️⬆️⬆️

https://t.co/NeE3DcJmNJ

Good luck to @TeamUSA and our New York athletes competing at the Olympics—we’re rooting for you!

https://t.co/OvwgiG0VWt

The House this week will vote on their bill for the Senate-passed U.S. Innovation and Competition Act.

With this next step, we will be closer to passing this bill into law, to help fix supply chains, lower costs, and bring manufacturing back home.

Thanks to the skill and bravery of our Armed Forces, we have taken off the battle­field the leader of ISIS.

I want to thank the incredible work of our brave military servicemembers, who work day and night to keep Americans safe.

For years, I’ve worked to get the federal government to help rebuild Puerto Rico’s failing power grid.

I’m happy to see the Biden administration has heeded my call and is supporting a renewable, distributed, reliable, and resilient energy grid for our fellow Americans. https://t.co/b3pOZ29rQ6
Sorry that I misspoke earlier today. Of course, I remember the dedication and legal excellence that Thurgood Marshall brought to the Supreme Court.

A quarter of all Black women who sit on the federal bench today were nominated by President Biden.

In fact, nearly 70% of all of the President’s nominees have been non-white, surpassing the records of every single president since at least Jimmy Carter.

https://t.co/RjlBSxhdKG

President Biden’s judicial nominees are both more diverse AND more qualified than almost any president's in recent history!

https://t.co/RjlBSxhdKG
Under President Biden and this Senate Democratic Majority, we’re taking historic steps to make our courts look more like the country they serve by confirming highly-qualified, diverse nominees.
Thank you to President Biden for meeting yesterday to talk about a broad range of issues on the Democratic agenda—including his intention to nominate the first Black Woman to the Supreme Court!

Ethel Waters, known for her unique vocal style, rose to fame performing in Harlem and on Broadway in the 1920s.

She was the first African American to star in her own TV show in 1939 & the first African American woman to be nominated for a Primetime Emmy Award. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/hCi7xp0Dpa

Breathing clean air shouldn’t be a luxury. I’m proud President Biden’s @EPA is taking action to limit mercury and other toxic air pollution will protect kids and vulnerable communities!

https://t.co/zqQdU4M0wr

And we'll keep fighting for equality and fairness for our fellow citizens in Puerto Rico. https://t.co/taiEAHChxm

Last year’s historic turnaround is a reminder that the right leadership in government matters.

We will keep working to lower costs and grow the economy for the American people. https://t.co/fQyys1YHHC
Today would be a great day for President Biden and Vice President Harris to #CancelStudentDebt.

I stand with @SaneEnergy, @RepMaloney, and @NydiaVelazquez in working to get @NYSDEC to reject unneeded new gas infrastructure for the North Brooklyn Pipeline.

Dr. Anna Arnold Hedgeman was a civil rights leader, politician, educator, and writer.

She was the first African-American woman to serve on the cabinet of an NYC Mayor and was a champion for African-American women in her field #BlackHistoryMonth. https://t.co/138rq32zHw
Today, the Senate will confirm more of President Biden’s nominees, including associate judges for the District of Columbia!
My thoughts are with Senator Ben Ray Luján and his family. I’m so glad to hear that he will make a full recovery. We look forward to his quick return to the Senate. https://t.co/vDSXG6JF72
The Senate will continue today confirming President Biden’s highly-qualified nominees so they can carry out their mission of serving the American people!

After Congress passed the American Rescue Plan, I said “help is on the way.”

Last year’s historic turnaround is a reminder that the right leadership in government matters. https://t.co/WDPMOpU0lW

115 individuals have been chosen to sit on the U.S. Supreme Court—but never has a Black woman sat on the Highest Court in the Land.

@POTUS will have an opportunity to make SCOTUS look more like America by nominating the first Black woman in U.S. history to serve as a Justice.

Happy Lunar New Year to everyone celebrating in New York, across America, and around the world!

I wish you good fortune, happiness, and a flourishing #YearOfTheTiger. #LunarNewYear

Aaron Douglas was a major figure in the Harlem Renaissance.

An iconic graphic artist and painter, his images of African American life and struggles, including his illustrations for Alain Locke, earned him international acclaim. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/U2RKaY10kn

Today marks the beginning of #BlackHistoryMonth!

Every day this month I'll be honoring the achievements and contributions of Black Americans who have helped shape New York's history. Follow along as we celebrate the perseverance and legacy of Black Americans in New York!

Inadequate charging infrastructure for e-bike batteries is leading to dangerous fires across our city

Delivery workers are most at risk

That’s why I am working with #LosDeliveristasUnidos and @workersjusticep for hubs to provide safe charging and more

https://t.co/43HpQIaIQM

Earlier this month, I stood with Rochester’s frontline healthcare workers to work to get them the help they desperately needed to combat this COVID surge.

Today, I am pleased to say the Biden admin has listened to us and will provide the needed help.

https://t.co/AJICna97Wv
@m_wyscarver Millions of Americans need this relief. President Biden should #CancelStudentDebt, and I won't stop working to get this done.
President Biden will have an opportunity to make history by nominating the first-ever black woman to serve on the Supreme Court!
The Senate just voted to move forward on the nomination of Bridget Brennan to serve as a District Judge for the Northern District of Ohio!
The American Rescue Plan. The Historic Infrastructure Package. This economy is making a historic turnaround—and we'll keep working for American families. https://t.co/WDPMOpU0lW
It’s the largest single-year growth rate in almost forty years! https://t.co/WDPMOpU0lW
